@graph.name: Child of Night, Crowjane, C. Corp
@graph.description: Child of Night has cast their shadow over the underground electronic scene since 2017. They've released several cassette EPs and demos as well as one full length LP entitled "The Walls at Dawn." The band has toured repeatedly since forming, performing over 150 times across the US. 2025 will see the release of their to be titled sophomore LP as well as more touring.

@graph.name: Gold Rush: Wednesday Night Titans Live in LA
@graph.description: Get transported back to the 1980s heyday of professional wrestling with Wednesday Night Titans. Under the guise of their stage personas, wrestler Ted Technical (Kevin Scott) and manager, Stix "Hit Man" Jenkins (Zach Danziger) the two spar with legends Hulk Hogan, Dusty Rhodes, "Nature Boy" Ric Flair, and more. Wednesday Night Titans delivers an innovative multi-media combination of visual elements triggered by future-fusion instrumentals.

@graph.name: John Francis Flynn
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

John Francis Flynn

3/18/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

John Francis Flynn is a singer and multi-instrumentalist who creates contemporary music using traditional and folk material. His debut album “I Would Not Live Always” was released on Rough Trade imprint River Lea Records in 2020, earning rave reviews and winning 2 awards at the RTE Folk Awards. His second album "Look Over the Wall, See the Sky" has picked up where his debut left off, a bold and singular testimony that has won a nomination for Choice Album of the Year.

The critical acclaim John enjoys is in no small part thanks to his uncanny ability to masterfully unpick traditional songs and rearrange them with an emotional force. They float in a surreal space between the past and the present, the analog and the digital, between love and tragedy.The unconventional use of instruments and jagged arrangements gives the work a magnetism by drawing you into its curious orbit of experimental folk. Look Over The Wall, See The Sky is a re-imagining of traditional Irish music: powerful, hopeful and free.

@graph.name: Charli Adams
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Charli Adams

with Fire Swimmer, b0dies

3/19/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Hailing from Alabama, Charli Adams is a singer-songwriter who found her musical calling at a young age. Leaving high school to finish online in a coffee shop, Adams’ relocated to Nashville, Tennessee at 17 years old. Her makeshift college music history course was sifting through the dollar CD bin at her local record store, while immersing herself in the vibrant local scene. Testing out songs and honing her craft, she began recording her debut EP “Good At Being Young”. Her first release garnered recognition from none other than Taylor Swift, who handpicked Charli's self-penned track, "Backseat," to be featured on her personally curated Women's Day Playlist on Apple Music. This co-sign marked the beginning of Charli's rise in the industry.

Charli released her critically-acclaimed debut album, "Bullseye," which earned high praise from respected publications such as EARMILK, DORK, The Fader, NPR, Billboard, and Line of Best Fit. Collaborations with renowned artists like Ruston Kelly, Novo Amor, and Nightly further solidified her reputation as an artist to watch. With an overflowing passion for songwriting, she has also penned songs for artists like Chloe Moriondo, Yot Club, Peach Pit, Valley & many more.

Charli's musical journey might have started in her bedroom, but on the stage is where her music truly comes alive. With an unmatched ability to connect with her audience on a personal level, she quickly made a name for herself in the Nashville scene and beyond. Whether performing with her band or solo, Charli's undeniable stage presence revealed that the spotlight is her natural habitat. With a voice that resonates and a sound that captivates, Charli is an artist poised for greatness, enchanting hearts with her unique blend of haunting vocals and cinematic storytelling.

@graph.name: The Factory Club Presents Wavelords & Friends
@graph.description: The Factory Club presents Wavelords! With support from Sun Spoiler, Terabyte & Dj Esli. Show starts at 7:30pm and goes until late for a dance party consisting of Italo Disco / New Wave / Disco & Dance Classics.

@graph.name: Supertaste
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Supertaste

with My Friend Catie, Xica Soul

3/21/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Supertaste is an indie dance band from Brooklyn, NY. The trio specializes in their live ensemble performance, instrumentation, and nods to intergenerational funk, disco, and dance music influences. Through yearly retreats to a cabin in Tennessee to hone in their sound, Supertaste has developed a colossal atmosphere of sparkling synths, Chic-inspired guitar riffs, and unforgettable hooks.

The music is an exploration of life’s little moments: a carefree late night at a club, the relaxed energy of spending time with close friends, and finding the sound that hits just right at the perfect moment.

Whether you run into them late night at a bodega ordering sandwiches or on-stage performing, you’ll always be met with a smile. The Supertaste Cinematic Universe only continues to expand. Expect some big moments and bigger jams.

The riffs are righteous. The shred is rambunctious. The energy? Honestly, pretty sweaty and hot. Let’s have a time.

See you on the dance floor.

@graph.name: Visions, Substance, Freedom Curse
@graph.description: Portland post-punk band Visions tour on their second album 'Decay' with local favorites Substance and Freedom Curse

@graph.name: showlist presents TO HERE KNOWS WHEN
@graph.description:
TREMOURS formed in Los Angeles in 2021 by the duo of Lauren Andino and Glenn Fryatt. Late night jam sessions in the midst of lockdown uncertainty slowly transformed into TREMOURS creative partnership, driven by the tension between Andino’s hazy, drifting guitars and Fryatt’s urgent, pulsating drums. Since forming, TREMOURS have undertaken three full US tours, most recently supporting label mates The Dandy Warhols and LSD and the Search for God, garnering a following across North America and Europe. TREMOURS also headlined Canada’s Cherry Cult Fest and embarked on their first UK tour. Fragments is their much-anticipated debut album, released on February 7, 2025 via Little Cloud Records.

HEAVEN ride a massive sonic wave in delivering their dear and dreamy tracks. Matt Sumrow and Mikey Jones created Heaven in the wake of touring and recording with artists such as DEAN and BRITTA, SWERVEDRIVER, AMBULANCE LTD, CAVEMAN, the COMAS, the LEMONHEADS, and others. Now joined by bassist Sonia Manalili, after a deep collective pandemic slumber, the NYC based trio are prepping a new release and their most somnambulistic to date. Their 3rd full length Dream Aloud will be released April 4, 2025 on Little Cloud Records.

@graph.name: Songs To Smoke Cigarettes To
@graph.description:
DJs Lil Pri & Josh Lomat

"Songs to Smoke Cigarettes To" is an event that features indie hits, psychedelic rock, and alternative tracks from artists like Tame Impala, Passion Pit, Arctic Monkeys, MGMT, Mac DeMarco, and Pond. It's all about vibing out to the best of indie and alternative music, creating a perfect soundtrack for your night.

@graph.name: Damaged Disco with Hallows and Holy Water
@graph.description:
Join us for a night of modern electronic darkwave as Damaged Disco returns to Gold-Diggers on Thursday March 27 with live performances by Hallows and Holy Water, plus music from resident DJ DAT68!

Hallows is a duo consisting of Vanee Dusoruth and Dom Rolando. The band explores themes of unease, longing, and sadness in their music drawing from traditional darkwave but with a modern electronic approach. The pair released music on labels including Phage Tapes and Cold Transmission before releasing their sophomore album, A Quieter Life, via their in-house label Stoic Media in 2023. Their latest single "Find A Way" came out in February. Hallows is touring throughout March and has performed at festivals including Substance Fest, Verboden Fest, and Sanctum.

Holy Water combines a love of electronic dance music with the energy and ethos of punk and hardcore. Jacob Desrochers established Holy Water in 2018 after 12 years doing DJ gigs playing indie dance, tech house, industrial, and post-punk. Jacob came up in the Northern California punk/hardcore scene. His band Lonely Kings released four albums on Fearless Records and toured with bands like At The Drive In, Hot Water Music, The Misfits, and AFI. Since forming Holy Water he has shared the stage with acts including Soft Kill, Actors, Adult., TR/ST, Glass Spells, Cold Cave, and Sacred Skin.

With resident DJ DAT68 spinning minimal wave, dark disco, industrial, and post-punk.

Damaged Disco night is a monthly event with live performances of minimal synth and post-punk artists curated by the Damaged Disco label, happening on the last Thursday of each month at Gold-Diggers.

@graph.name: Early James
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Early James

with Will Worden

3/28/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Early James recorded his first two Easy Eye Sound albums, Singing For My Supper (2020) and Strange Time To Be Alive (2022), at the studio inside the vaunted label’s Nashville headquarters. But for James’ third release, Medium Raw, producer and Easy Eye Sound label head Dan Auerbach envisioned something quite different for the Alabama-bred singer-songwriter- guitarist’s rawboned, sometimes scarifying music.

“Day of the first session, I had my GPS routed to Easy Eye,” James recalls. “We ran into some traffic, and I texted \[engineer M.\] Allen \[Parker\] — ‘Hey man, sorry, we’re gonna be about 15 minutes late.’ And he said, ‘It’s OK, we’re still getting set up at the house.’ And I was like, ‘What house?’ ‘We’re recording at this house, it’s really cool.’ It was news to me! It felt unusual in the moment, which I think makes you play the songs differently. But I’m really happy with and proud of the results.”

“I wanted to try to find that power of when I first saw him, when it was just him and his guitar,” Auerbach explains. “After working with him a couple of times in the studio, I felt like I wasn’t going to be able to do it in the same kind of way. The comforts and luxuries of the studio, where you’re able to hear everything and make adjustments and changes, wasn’t right for this project.”

“Some of my favorite albums are those Arhoolie records produced by Chris Strachwitz that were recorded in houses, by Fred McDowell, Lightnin’ Hopkins. I felt like we might get better results if we did it in a house.”

@graph.name: 2forever presents ACCIDENTALS
@graph.description:
2forever presents ACCIDENTALS

Featuring:

Sarah & Collin

Sally Spitz

Magic Candy

Sheep Chase

Accidentals is a night by artists for artists. It is a space to share new music, fine tune unreleased tracks, perform songs that may not fit into a main artist project, and try something new. Come listen to what Los Angeles’s left field has to offer.

@graph.name: Mary Chicken Soup and Rice w/ Atlas Engine, Santos & The Crystal Visions
@graph.description: Mary Chicken Soup and Rice w/ Atlas Engine, Santos & The Crystal Visions

@graph.name: GHOST COP
@graph.description:
New York Dark Wave / Post Punk darlings and Synthicide regulars, GHOST COP make their Los Angeles debut.

Blending elements of dark wave, post punk, synth pop, and horror soundtracks, GHOST COP has built an underground following around the world. Comprised of Lucy Swope and Sean Dack, they are as influenced by the gloomy forebears of yesteryear as they are by B- movie soundtracks. Their music ranges from dystopian dance floor heaters to cinematic anthems and vocoder lullabies, pairing strident beats with haunting melodies and lyrical storytelling. They are touring in support of their second full length album TROUBLE, out now.

@graph.name: Gotta Have Soul
@graph.description: Gold Diggers presents “Gotta Have Soul”, a funk / soul / disco party taking place first Thursdays. Featuring DJ Guy Keltner (of Acid Tongue) and DJ Avalon York, the party will feature rare underground vinyl and far out sounds of the 60s and 70s.

@graph.name: Damaged Disco presents Chalk Teeth with Kontrol Inc
@graph.description: Damaged Disco presents Chalk Teeth with Kontrol Inc

@graph.name: Grace Cummings
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Grace Cummings

with Adriana McCassim

4/5/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Critically acclaimed Australian artist Grace Cummings hit a new high in 2024 with the release of third album, Ramona. “It felt like the wind of a hurricane entered the room,” said fan and new friend, Angel Olsen. “I remember feeling so activated and surprised by Grace’s vocal capacity that I actually felt my body brace itself against the wall.“

Acclaimed worldwide in outlets ranging from PAPER to The Guardian, Uncut to NPR, Ramona is a work of raw truth rendered in its most beautiful form. In a departure from the self-produced approach of her 2019 debut Refuge Cove and its 2022 follow-up Storm Queen—the Melbourne-based artist worked with producer Jonathan Wilson (Angel Olsen, Father John Misty, Margo Price) at his Topanga Canyon studio to dream up a lavishly orchestrated sound that fully accommodates the depth and scope of her vocal prowess.

With its visceral reflection on grief and self-destruction and emotional violence, Ramona brings a stunning new grandeur to Cummings’ music while refusing to soften or temper its humanity. “It’s emotional and grand, like a metamorphosis in real time,” Rolling Stone.

@graph.name: Jake Xerxes Fussell
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Jake Xerxes Fussell

with Harrison Whitford

4/6/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Jake Xerxes Fussell is a singer, guitarist, and composer based in Durham, NC. His intuitive creative process often draws from traditional music and archival field recordings - incorporating elements of songs from the past into new work. He is, according to Ann Powers of NPR, "maybe the leading interpreter of American folk music right now..."

Fussell’s most recent album When I’m Called was released to critical acclaim by Fat Possum Records in the summer of 2024. The album was produced by James Elkington and features Blake Mills (guitars), Ben Whiteley (bass), and Joe Westerlund (drums), along with additional vocals from Joan Shelley and Robin Holcomb.

Fussell and Elkington also wrote and recorded the music for Rebuilding, a new feature film directed by Max Walker-Silverman that is set to premiere at the 2025 Sundance Film Festival.

“Fussell’s music often comes with complex citations; he is a folksinger in the truest sense, collecting ideas and melodies and lyrics from distant and disparate traditions, looking for the things that unite us in our humanity.” - The New Yorker

“(Fussell) is one of the great magpies of American song, collecting forgotten, tarnished gems with a folklorist’s zeal… his renditions aren’t so much cover versions as composites…” – The Guardian

@graph.name: Shower Curtain, Mo Dotti
@graph.description: shower curtain started as the solo project of Victoria Winter in 2018 in Curitiba, Brazil, and has since developed into a indie rock four piece based out of Brooklyn, NY alongside Ethan Williams (guitar/vocals), Sean Terrell (drums), and Cody Hudgins (bass). shower curtain brings dreamy melodies to the forefront of their music, bolstered by instrumental distortion and insulated by fuzz. Their debut album ‘words from a wishing well’ was released in October 2024 via Angel Tapes/Fire Talk Records, sketching early adulthood experiences in swirling layers of guitars, bringing the sludgy distortion of 90s shoegaze and grunge and establishing shower curtain as a standout in the city’s latest crop of bands.

@graph.name: Stepping Stone Presents India Ramey w/ Nocona + DJ Dandy Randy
@graph.description:
India Ramey blazes a trail through cinematic spaghetti western landscapes to wood floored Honkytonks and the Appalachian foothills. India’s musical journey was not typical. “Having grown up poor, there was a lot of pressure for me to ‘go to college and make money’ so I convinced myself that music was a hobby”. Ramey, a domestic violence survivor got a law degree and became a domestic violence prosecutor. “I thought if I was helping people like my Mom, I would like being a lawyer more”. Despite her love of helping people, Ramey’s love for music won in the end. She gave up her law career to become a full time musician and songwriter and has never looked back.

Since then Ramey has put out five studio albums. Her 2017 album, and first national release, Snake Handler landed her on Rolling Stone's 10 New Country Artists You Need To Know list and earned her praise and attentions from American Songwriter, The Bluegrass Situation among others . Her 2020 album Shallow Graves earned her even more recognition from the likes of Ralph McClean of the BBC who said "Ramey is a singer of the truth. Long may she shine" and Rolling Stone who named her a pick of the week and featured a full interview and review calling her "Part honky-tonk, part Black Sabbath". She has been a two time SXSW and a three time Americanafest showcasing artist and recently released her fifth studio album, Baptized By The Blaze produced by Luke Wooten (The SteelDrivers, Sunny Sweeney, Deirks Bentley, Brad Paisley).

Released in August 2024, Baptized By The Blaze has taken off and is proving to be India's most successful album yet receiving high praise from Saving Country Music, No Depression, American Songwriter, The Bluegrass Situation and many more. She is touring extensively and has had the pleasure of opening for rising Outlaw Country and Americana star, Corb Lund and Grammy-nominated Maggie Rose. Ramey will start off her 2025 in the line-up of the Sirius XM Outlaw Country Cruise and has spring tour dates filling up her calendar.

@graph.name: Grivo, Lockstep, Kraus, Seko
@graph.description: Emerging like an ornate relic, Austin-based power trio Grivo combines slow, methodical hooks and warm tube amplifiers to artfully re-establish the line between heavy guitars and downtempo pop. Within the tidal sound waves and bleak timbre, Grivo forges a distinctive personal connection that challenges the modern definitions of doom metal and shoegaze.

@graph.name: Desert Daze Nights: Deaf Club w/ Object of Affection
@graph.description:
Desert Daze Nights presents Deaf Club w/ Object of Affection!

Deaf Club is a savage sound bath dripping with sardonicism: a blastbeat-centric hardcore punk assault channeling crust, thrash, and grind (un)sensibilities. Succinct pauses, surreal frequencies and effects, breakneck pace and sharply hurled vocals characterize the band’s aesthetic, which seems as though it is rooted in a sort of nasty-sound-meets-highbrow-message ethos. Fueled by the onslaught of society’s insanity and driven mad by tinnitus, Justin Pearson (The Locust, Dead Cross, Planet B), Brian Amalfitano (ACxDC), Scott Osment (Weak Flesh), and Jason Klein (Run With The Hunted), approach music as an opportunity to confront our collective sicknesses. We’ve got to try to listen, lest we all frolic headfirst towards the bright side of death, dragging this pillaged planet down with us. So whether you think the music is a radical disruption to the airwaves or just headache-inducing noise, you can feel free to tell them the brutal truth– they can’t hear you anyway.
